JobFullDesc: The Director of Care Management LTC Operations will be responsible for identifying gaps and barriers in the delivery of the care management model and lead the implementation of agreed to solutions.  The Director will leverage knowledge of data, systems, processes and programs to provide the operational oversight. The Director of Care Management Operations will be responsible for collaborating with departmental Directors and managers to create budgets and develop business plans.• Provide leadership to ensure the provision of member centered care management with efficient and cost effective operations in conjunction with the VP, Care Management- LTC and in collaboration with the Care Management- LTC leadership team.• Monitor the day-to-day operations of care management-LTC to ensure smooth progress toward managing quality of care, adherence to compliance with standards and improving overall operations.• Evaluate overall performance of the care management programs by gathering, analyzing and interpreting data and metrics.• Create process and dashboards that represent improved clinical and business processes through analysis and collaboration with the care management leaders.• Lead special projects and support clinical projects by ensuring all reports are completed timely and adhere to regulatory standards and HF policies and procedures.• Collaborate with care management leaders to develop budget planning, preparation and adherence along with budget reforecasting.• Responsible owner for all the Care Management Partnership Service Level Agreements and key performance indicators (KPIs). Collaborates with the various departments ;i.e. Clinical Eligibility, Care Management, Finance, and Ancillary to ensure all SLAs are adhered to , revised and updated, and reaffirmed by the partnerships routinely.• Participate and assist in long term business planning at the managerial and executive level for the Integrated Product Lines• Co-owner of the Quality Health Incentive Program (QHIP), with the collaboration of the Population Health Department. Ensures the yearly QHIP goals and initiatives are directed and implemented to the responsible recipients timely.• Responsible for the welcome and enrollment and disenrollment activities of member coming on the plan’s Integrated Product lines.• Performs other activities as assignedMinimum Qualifications:A Licensed New York State RN with Bachelor’s Degree from and accredited institution or LMSW or LCSW is required. Additional Job Description:People management experience - Master’s degree from an accredited institution - Strong communication skills and interpersonal skills - Strong Project Management/lead experience - Strong leadership, interpersonal, communication and managerial skills to lead, motivate and direct staff and work collaboratively across multiple departments. - Working knowledge of: organizational policies, and procedures; health care delivery systems and administrative practices; computer systems and applications; and working knowledge of medical billing, coding and insurance coverageWE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.
